parameters: \pop[2]The screwdrivers are half empty by now, and I can feel it in my head.
\pop[2]I definitely don't think I'd be drinking as much as I did at the nightclub.
\pop[2]Glances are exchanged, as stories of "the good old days" are told.
\pop[3]Didn't know you were \c[14]that\c[0] into cosplay, Dante.
That's actually how I ended up meeting Isaac.
He had a bit of a fanboy moment when he saw me.
\pop[2]He strikes a pose, like he's thinking.
\pop[3]So if we traded clothes, we'd be cosplaying as each other?
\pop[3]You know, sometimes it feels like I am.
\pop[3]You know, putting on an act while I perform.
And keeping that persona going during interviews?
\pop[4]There's \c[14]no\c[0] way you could pull his stage outfit off.
\pop[3]I reckon I could pull it off in a couple different ways, actually.
\pop[3]Wow, you're all so smooth. I'm flattered.
But we were talking about Isaac's fanboying...?
That phase of my life is \c[14]so\c[0] over.
He was pretty timid by the time he met me.
\pop[4]I never actually heard the story of how you two met.
Though I imagine it's a low point in the saga of our universe.
I was working, and he basically broke in the front door.
All he said was "help me". But that's all I needed to hear.
\pop[3]You do seem to have a penchant for helping people in need.
\pop[4]Makes it easier to fall asleep at night.
But yeah, a bunch of fans were chasing him down.
So I let him hide in the back of my store, and I drove him home.
\pop[4]How did you know he wasn't just some creep?
\pop[4]But I knew his intentions were pure.
And even if they weren't, I've got a bat in my trunk.
\pop[4]Like you could take me in a fight.
Actually, it's still in my trunk, even today.
So make sure to remember that next time you cross me.
I mean, it kinda seems like you all hate each other.
\pop[4]Actually, hate is now a valid form of love.
\pop[2]Taylor blushes, and the subject is abruptly changed.
\pop[4]Oh, we've been friends online for a loooong time.
We were chatting on-and-off throughout all of these stories.
As soon as they mentioned they wanted to move, I invited them over.
\pop[2]He tilts his head toward Klace, in an inconspicuous fashion.
\pop[4]Right. I actually met Klace through Taylor's stream.
Figured I'd offer to house him while he took a break from work.
\i[3]"I keep saying you'll bring a lot of stories to the table."
\i[3]"I keep saying you'll bring a lot of stories to the table."
We talk about you quite a bit in the group chat.
\pop[3]Am I allowed to join it, by the way?
Let me think about it a little more.
\pop[2]He grabs his cup and chugs the rest of his drink.
\pop[3]Well, there's something we used to play back on the colony.
It'd help us to get to know each other better.
\pop[3]Really? We played a game like that at the nightclub last week.
I'm down for more, though. It's fun to learn about all of you.
\pop[2]He grips the pen in his hand as he speaks, like he's ready to write more.
\pop[3]It's pretty simple, but we can make it more interesting.
How about I grab another round? You know, for punishments.
We have to reveal private information about ourselves.
And if we don't want to, then we risk getting blackout drunk.
\pop[3]Hey, you'll be \c[10]spilling your guts\c[0] either way.
\pop[2]With a smirk, Kyron goes off to order us another round.
\pop[2]I assume Isaac loaded his account with some money to spend.
\pop[2]Maybe I'll get the next round. I wouldn't want him to go broke so fast.
\pop[2]It's actually pretty cool how I'm learning about life on the colony.
\pop[2]They even have games to learn about your friends, just like we do.
\pop[2]In fact, I'm willing to bet that the game Kyron wants to play is pretty similar.
\pop[2]I finish the rest of my screwdriver, and await his return.
\pop[2]Every minute that passes, I'm more confident that we're in the right.
\pop[2]All of the \c[10]zeros\c[0] should be able to experience what we've given Kyron.
\pop[2]Whether by \c[10]Cipher\c[0] or \c[23]Argus\c[0]' hands, it needed to happen...
